I consider myself a bit of an action junkie, so most of my games are shooters. Having only played a little bit of Half-Life 1 on PS2 (which really doesn't do justice to the PC version), I decided I'd give Half-Life 2 a try, and see what all the fuss was about. The gameplay is simple but smooth. The Gravity Gun is a great unique edge, setting the game apart from typical shooters. There are no gaping flaws. On top of this, I was immediately blown away by the dystopian setting, and brilliantly executed Orwellian atmosphere. The story of Half-Life is incredibly executed, and City 17 echoes the oppression of a Soviet dictatorship. The settings range from Vertigo style "fugitive-on-the-run" rooftop setpieces to dark, terrifying villages, overrun with monsters, to vehicular chase sequences on land and sea. This may evoke a worry of suffering the GTA syndrome, of having many features, but not being very good at any of them. The shooting is what it needs to be, and is on at least the same level as Halo. It is slick, and has a good feel to it. The story is one of the best gaming has told. It had me invested the whole way through. I don't want to say too much out of fear of spoiling it. Of course the opening "rooftop-runner" setpiece isn't a patch on Mirror's Edge, but that game was built around parkour, and so is an unfair comparison. The horror based level won't be as frightening as Amnesia or Penumbra, but if you aren't scared by it, you must lack a soul. The vehicles don't handle as well as in Forza or GT, but this ain't a racing game! And in relation to the chases they are utilised in, it is every bit as thrilling as being chased by cops through Liberty City/Los Santos. It surely beats an modern-military turret section by several, several, several, several miles.

Another incredible feat is that Half-Life isn't laid out in distinct levels. Chapter titles may flash on the screen, and you can choose a particular point in the game where to start from. But never do you leave Gordon Freeman's perspective. You are put in the shoes of a protagonist on what feels like an Odyssean epic, and it gives the game a liberatingly open feel. It may be seen as linear, as in the end, the aim is to get from Point A to Point B (as was almost the literal plot for Half-Life 1), but it's more a case of being given a vast map, and that map is your playground, to execute your objectives on your own terms. It. Is. Wonderful.

Overall, Half-Life 2 is nothing short of phenomenal. It is ten years old, but it blows every modern shooter out of the water. It even graphically holds up. You don't need to be a fan of action games or Sci-Fi. If you love games, you owe it to yourself to play Half-Life 2 (and check out it's predecessor).

Písal sa rok 1998 a svetlo sveta uzrela hra Half-Life 2. V tej dobe nádherné grafické a herné akcie. Pekný a fascinujúci príbeh. Herný debut, ktorý dostal množstvo ocenení.
V dnešnej dobe samozrejme zaostáva za dnešnými grafickými a zvukovými efektmi, ale pre zaspomínanie si na dôb minulých, je to pekná otočka späť.
Okrem príbehu, hlavného hrdinu treba pozdvihnúť veľký arzenál zbraní, ktorý sa navyšuje postupným hraním. Misie delená do ďalších podmisíí. Od mesta, cez bažiny. pustatiny či miestam zasiahnutých votrelcam sa nakoniec prebojujete sa až k samotnej Citadele.
Proste skvelá hra a kúpiť si ju s kupónom so zľavou 90% a doplatiť 0,70€ ... No kto by to nevzal!
Pre pobavenie a odreagovanie sa je to vešmi výborná vecička + s doplnkom Half-Life 2: Lost Coast.
Odporúčam.
Hodnotenie: 10/10

What more is their to say? It is what games need to be like and what it feels to play a great one at that! This game is not overrated at all. Although i had some diffculties understanding the story (because i haven't played the first one) and sometimes it feels like a i've been their done that routine simply because it plays like the first major FPS that i've played back in the day better known as Halo:Combat Evolved, it doesn't mean that this game is un-unique or lacking some type of quality. This is a very well done game with graphics, gameplay, and immersiveness. It feels like you are really some type of semi-super soldier on a quest to defend humanity and bring back peace to the lives once lost. My personal rating is definately ... a 10/10. I was always wondering what was the big ass deal about this game, well now i know. Half-Life 2 is a MUST-PLAY game if you have not tried wondering into the life of Gordan Freeman (Main Character). Let us just hope that one day ... Half-Life 3 will be a reality and will be something so mysterious and rewarding, it will bring gaming back to its old roots.

While I do admit that this game has its flaws, like any other game, a lot of people don't appreciate the storyline of the Half-Life franchise. It starts out with Gordon Freeman arriving at work in Black Mesa. He is a theoretical physicist tasked with delivering a crystal specimen into a test chamber. When the whole experiment goes to hell, he has to fight through it to survive. To avoid spoiling the story, I'll skip way ahead to the events of HL2. There, the Combine, a transuniversal alien race, has surgically altered many humans to suppress the survivors on their behalf in an effort to take over Earth. The Combine has drained a significant portion of the oceans, as well as sucking the Earth dry of its resources. The level design will often reflect that, such as in Ravenholm, where the once-living residents of the town are now shambling corpses hostile to living humans, and gruesome sights are commonplace. Then there's the coast, where the dock is now on the beach because the shore has receded quite far back due to aforementioned draining of the oceans. Due to Gordon Freeman's actions, however, he sparks a revolution to overthrow Combine rule and take back Earth.

What's often overlooked is his silence. The whole reason that Gordon Freeman never speaks is because it would ruin it for a lot of people. His character is never known for talking, and even Gabe Newell himself acknowledges that Gordon Freeman should not talk.  You can interpret it in many ways, but I like to think of it as being a "silent badass"

As for the flaws I mentioned earlier, I do admit that the game feels slightly empty given the fact that there are less weapons this time around. But you have to remember that the developers did consider adding some of HL1's weapons back in, but they had reasons for throwing these ideas out. Finally, the description of the game does oversell it, but it's a fantastic game nonetheless. You rarely see a game bringing these ideas to the table, let alone executing them in such an expert manner. The only reason I can see someone would be disappointed with this game is because many games today emulate the Half-Life series, and by now Half-Life's themes seem so commonplace. Nevertheless, this game is still so, so unique and can be instantly distinguished at a mere glance from most other games in existence. That is just a further testament to its long-standing originality, professional design, and overall excellence.

tl;dr - Amazing game, especially for its time, even with its minor flaws. 9.9/10

Half-Life 2 es uno de esos juegos que nunca envejecen. La jugabilidad es muy superior a muchos de los FPS actuales, en parte por la fantástica "pistola antigravedad". El juego además siempre proporciona varias maneras creativas de acabar con tus oponentes. 
La inmersión es espectacular, debido a la cantidad de detalles que VALVe añadió (en los escenarios, la banda sonora, etc.). El ambiente opresivo de Ciudad 17 es sin duda una de las cosas mejor logradas en toda la historia de los videojuegos. 
Las armas están equilibradas y la calidad gráfica continua siendo extrañamente buena, aunque se notan los años en comparación con los juegos actuales. 
Cada parte está estructurada majestuosamente. Conforme vas avanzando vas adquiriendo armas nuevas, lo que abre más posibilidades a la hora de neutralizar a los enemigos. Las partes de vehículos, aunque a veces largas, siempre intercalan tiroteos en los que has de bajarte y caminar. la cohesión de los hechos es magnífica.
La historia está contada de una manera espectacular, muy creíble (de hecho, la mayor parte la has de deducir tú, gracias a pequeños comentarios de los diferentes personajes o a la narrativa visual que el juego ofrece en algunos momentos).
Aunque a veces se puede volver un poco lineal (sobre todo en las partes de vehículos) es un juego impresionante. Imprescindible el jugarlo. 10/10.
Este juego, junto con sus dos episodios, para mi es el mejor fps de la historia; largo, variado, divertido, buena historia, buenos graficos (cuando salió), etc. 100 % recomendable.

After playing this on the Orange Box for Xbox, I decided to get a copy of the Orange Box on Steam so I can keep it. I found the story amazing, very long for games I played, and the physics for it's age is quite great. This game, although Single Player only, can be funny for jamming objects in irregular places, glitching out corpses in doors, and getting some mods and playing with them. This game is the most-built on Source, so pretty much any mistakes or masterpieces you make on Hammer or Photoshop, or even 3D Coat, can be placed in it with probably quite good compatibility. The open worlds allow for you to pissfart around, and spawn stuff through the console. A tremendous game, even for those just for looksies. The sequels to this game, Episode One, Two and Lost Coast are quite interesting, so I recommend them as well if you finish this and want to finish the story.

《半条命2》作为半条命系列的续作可以说从发布开始就经历了坎坷。作为2004年的一款游戏、在那个显卡性能并不强大的年代，凭借强大的优化、顶级的画质、逼真的物理效果，《半2》为FPS游戏注入了许多新鲜血液。它的细节、画面直到今天还有许多可以圈圈点点的地方。
放置在地图边边角角的补给品、完美展示了物理引擎长处的独特的重力枪、经典的撬棍、NPC极高的AI表现、陪伴玩家的女主角与极强代入感的叙事过程，这无疑增强了半2的游戏性与可玩性。正因如此，这是我通关次数最多的一款游戏，因为它确实有值得品味的地方。
Still holds up as one of the great first person shooters. A must have and a must play title.

Наверное, тот факт, что я прошёл эту игру уже в третий раз, не говоря о том что начал её прохождение в пятый, стоит всех слов. Этой игре уже более девяти лет, но играя в неё не ощущаешь никакой устарелости, архаичности. Игра всё так же интригует, погружает вас в динамичный процесс, заставляет всё так же сильно сопереживать героям и всему прочему происходящему. Она так же умело удивляет вас и позволяет насладиться своей красотой. Графическая составляющая всё ещё держит позиции. А о физической составляющей я думаю не стоит и упоминать. Экшен, головоломки и Большая история, которая началась намного раньше и которая имеет продолжение, но к сожалению пока не имеет конца. Но этого не стоит пугаться. Время потраченное в этой игре потраченно не зря, если только вы не забыли покормить свою собаку. Если вы ещё не играли в эту игру, то я вам завидую. Приятной игры, друзья.

10/10
